result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Markel D Williams

defendant.name: Williams, Markel D
defendant.address: 3802 West Silver Spring Drive, Milwaukee, WI 53209

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Markel D Williams not in court, in custody.  
Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Markel D Williams.  
Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case calendared for a Plea and Sentencing.
Court is in receipt of defense counsel request for an adjournment.
Defense advises the court he need time to determine the p[posture of defendant federal matter.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. 
 Parties advised this hearing will be held in person, Room 313 of the Safety Building.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 14 pages) commencing 04-25-2022 by Amy De La Rosa.

Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in Court, Defendant Markel D Williams not in Court, in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Status Conference. Defendant's appearance waived for today's hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Court addressed Defendant's revocation hold. Defense has NOT received a GLOBAL offer; however, Defense advised the Court of potential resolution posture. Defense requested a plea/sentencing date. Case adjourned for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON.

Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court, defendant Markel D Williams not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Cerniglia appeared by video means. Defense has discovery and is asking for a global offer. Case is adjourned in Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Markel D Williams in court with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia; both appear by video.  Defendant Markel D Williams in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis Officer Best.  Court took judicial notice of 16CF4730. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Markel D Williams in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Markel D Williams in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Markel D Williams appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 3. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.     
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
